It is native to southern Africa and is characterized by its milky sap, which is often used in traditional medicine. The plants typically have woody stems and produce small, clustered flowers in shades of yellow or white. Barbeyastrum species are often found in arid or semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils. They are also valued for their ornamental qualities and are sometimes cultivated as garden plants.
